resources.string:
1. Place eggs in the bottom of a saucepan
  2. Heat on high heat and bring the water to a full rolling boil. Optional:Adding 1/2 teaspoon of salt to the water will make the eggs easier to peel and help to prevent the shells from cracking.
  3. Turn off the heat, keep the pan on the hot burner, cover with a pot lid. Then the eggs let sit in the hot water for 10-12 minutes. Larger eggs / larger pots may increase cook time by a few extra minutes.
  4. Drain the water from the pot and run cold water over the eggs to cool them and to stop them from cooking. The eggs should be easier to peel once cooled down to room temperature.
